column4: Hi folks. The automount of my ubuntu do not open my pen drive and show this error: mount_point cannot contain the following character... Where i configure it ?
usually the mount point is extracted from the label of the filesystem. So i'd give the filesystem on the stick a name with standard characters only
stefg
https://help.ubuntu.com/community/RenameUSBDrive
thanks
I had change the label of usb driver, but the problem still persist
This problem began when I rename the mount point using nautilus... Any idea?
unmount and unplug the stick, then remove the subdir in /media. The automounter should take care of mountpoint creation. There's even some .hal-* files in /media which you should delete
then lg the stick back in and see if it changes soemthing
ok. I will try it.
Did not work... =/
same problem
look at dmesg (or !paste it )
http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/39861/
the device is /dev/sdb and I had removed .hal* files
looks perfectly normal.... hmmm. would be interesting if a reboot or hal rstart changes anything
the same usb driver works normally until I rename the mount point through nautilus...
where the automount gets the cached configurations of usb drives ?
no idea, but a reboot would refresh that
Ok. I will reboot then.
thanks for all
